issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;

- [ ] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.13 nightly 1 (build 4175, CL 1.11.34)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Slimjet Version 39.0.2.0 (based on Chromium 111.0.5563.41) (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Which device do you use?

Laptop

### Where is the problem encountered?

**CORS Issue**:  https://lvturbo.com/2jshfs7gfdym.html
**HTML Element**: https://www.techpowerup.com/forums/threads/ssd-help-thread.308586/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Disable cache for third-party requests, Block WebRTC, Block Push API, Block Location API, Hide your User-Agent (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Protect from DPI

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> @AdGuardTeam would appreciate some help when dealing with CORS policy as it started happening very often and some websites don't function properly,web players as well. Here is a simple example of the issue(see screenshot). So far what's worked for me was to create those two rules:

   `@@||akamai-video-content.com^$xmlhttprequest`
   `@@||lvturbo.com^$xmlhttprequest`

   but i'm not sure that this is the proper way and i'm worry that my browser is more exposed this way.
   Please advise.
<details><summary>Screenshot ☝️ :</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here --> 
![CORS](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/34774426/21ab6df2-dd38-4183-8b1b-3d4cde7b9b65)

</details> 

2. <comment> Would also need some help properly removing HTML element(see screenshot). Tried many variations and the only rule so far that does the job is:

   `/*manifest*$domain=.......`

<details><summary>Screenshot ☝️ :</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![manifest](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/34774426/5b2d72f8-df51-4d1a-92bb-90a037029a3e)

</details>
Thank you and keep up the awesome work 👍 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
`$csp` seems to works fine on my end alongside with `$stealth` rule.
Please try to clear website cache or refresh website using <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>F5</kbd>
